answers.answer: It sounds like you might have PCOS (Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome). You have some of the symptoms. Have you noticed any excessive hair on your face/body? You need to see a gynecologist and have an ulltrasound done to check for ovarian cysts. They are mostly benign so don't worry, but they are a hassle to deal with. Surgery is necessary in some cases, depending on the type and size of cyst(s) you have. See the gynecologist soon. If left untreated, it does get worse and you will gain more weight. It could also lead to other diseases like diabetes or cardiovascular disease if left untreated. If you do have PCOS, you will be able to get some meds that will help control the symptoms, including the weight gain. Good luck!

question: I am 21 and have had a normal period for 4 and a half years but 8 months ago it stopped i went to the do (military docs) and very impatiently suggested birth control.  I am married but not stationed with my husband for the past 8 months i see him about once a month, but recently i have gained 30 pounds in about a month (w/no change in my diet), my hair is falling out bad, my hands swell in the morning really bad, i have constant headaches and sharp pains in my lower stomach when I cough and such. I am not pregnant i have taken several pregnancy test.  Please any ideas. (I have been to the doc it will be two more weeks till they can see me again).
title: No period for 8 months?
